definition: to banish from the court/to relegate
to diminish/to demote/to reduce or devaluate/to disparage/to censure/to depreciate
to relegate a high official to a minor post in an outlying region (punishment in imperial China)/to banish or exile/(of immortals) to banish from Heaven/to censure/to blame

sentences.english: Liuyuxi is an outstanding statesman and exiling poem in middle of Tang Dynasty .
sentences.chinese: 劉禹錫是中唐時期傑出的政治家兼貶謫詩人。

sentences.english: Nearly all Christian mystical writers relegate these phenomena to the periphery.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎所有的基督教神祕主義作家貶謫這些現象的邊緣。

sentences.english: This article talks about many-sided cultural value of relegation literature on Hainan Island.
sentences.chinese: 本文論述海南島貶謫文學多方面的文化學價值。

sentences.english: The loneliness complex formed in QU Yuans heart because he had been exiled for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 屈原孤獨情結緣於屈原遭貶並在長期的貶謫中生成。
